title: Latin Rectangle
content: A k×n Latin rectangle has n symbols where each row is a permutation and no column has repeats.

title: Counting Function L(k,n)
content: L(k,n) = number of k×n Latin rectangles. Central counting function in the problem.

title: Erdős-Kaplansky Formula
content: L(k,n) ~ e^{-C(k,2)} · (n!)^k where C(k,2) = k(k-1)/2. The conjectured asymptotic formula.

title: Erdős-Kaplansky (1946)
content: The formula L(k,n) ~ e^{-C(k,2)} · (n!)^k holds when k = o((log n)^{3/2-ε}).

title: Yamamoto (1951)
content: Extended the Erdős-Kaplansky formula to hold when k ≤ n^{1/3-o(1)}.

title: Matrix Permanent
content: perm(A) = Σ_σ Π_i A_{i,σ(i)}. Key tool for counting Latin rectangles via Godsil-McKay.

title: Extended Conjecture (Open)
content: Does the formula e^{-C(k,2)}(n!)^k hold for k = Θ(n)? This remains OPEN for k > n^{1/3}.

title: Problem Summary
content: PARTIALLY SOLVED: Formula L(k,n) ~ e^{-C(k,2)}(n!)^k proven for k ≤ n^{1/3-o(1)}. General k remains OPEN.
